Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Saba A
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, great food, Awesome location. The staff actually helped us on scheduling our 4 day trip to all the historical places in Istanbul. They are partnered with an excellent Travel Agency.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Istanbul brilliant location lovely quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireBones
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the seraglio hotel last week for 4 nights and were delighted with everything. Kenan on reception was extremely helpful, the breakfast and tea were great and the location is so near to the main sights as well as very good restaurants. ( literally 5minutes). Would certainly recommend to friends. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: Madoka84
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 days in Istanbul with my mom and we decided to go to this Hotel. We have been satisfied by our choice. The hotel is very clean and it is the most important thing for us. Room and bathroom without spots, they cleaned them every day. It is just 5 minutes on feet by the tram stop of sultanamhet, so it is very well linked to the rest of the city. Staff is very kind, they welcomed us very kindly with some te, they speak a good english, they helped us with all the info we needed. Breakfast is good, they even make express omelet, they have sweet and salt, maybe there isnt just a big variety of food, but it is ok. They have wi-fi, even if it is not sooo fast, but i travel a lot, and i can tell you it was one of the faster i've ever tested among all the hotels. The only complain is about the quality of the sleep. We wew at the first floor, close to the reception, there way too loud, ppl going and coming, but luckily i travel with earplugs, so i didnt have any problem, just ask for a room on the 2nd or 3rd floor :) I would definitelvy raccomend this place :)

Reviews.Title: “A Week at Seraglio”
Reviews.Author: Mark M
Reviews.Content: We were warmly greeted by Kenan, Front Desk Manager, and immediately felt most welcome! A small, cozy feel to the hotel with comfortable beds and quiet surroundings. Loved the location. Close to Aya Sofia, the Blue Mosque, Topkapi and the Tram Line. We stayed for seven nights and were extremely happy with all aspects of our stay. Staff very friendly and we had a secure feeling knowing that they were there to help us when needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: AyeAre
Reviews.Content: Very pleasantly surprised by just how good this place was. Spotlessly clean and tidy, very helpful staff and generally the best in the area. And don't miss out on 'tea time', a complimentary drink and cake in the afternoons! If I was on a second trip to Istanbul I would probably consider staying in a more modern area, but for the sites and the history this location is superb. For a first-time trip it comes highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: PietroMM
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel. Good price, outstanding staff, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: BeyondRachel
Reviews.Content: First time in Turkey and Istanbul. It was a cozy hotel. Turkish style everywhere, the paintings in corridor, the emerald table lamp, the light-green chair and cushine, etc. It was a bit cold during our stay, even we are the only ones to live on the third floor, they thoughtfully placed a heater on the corridor. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The restaurant was cozy like a family dining room. The hotel was located near the blue mosque, so all the main sightseeing places are within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “the best value for money in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: covaltio
Reviews.Content: 1st trip to Turkey, 1st visit in Istanbul just to take a quick taste from the neighboring country just fro 3 days and it was really a revelation. arrived with my friend at 09:00a.m and since we could not check in until 1:00 p.m Kenan at the reception desk showed us the breakfast area where they provided almost everything a big 4 star hotel does too. Rooms are impeccably clean, modern and warm. The location is unique, minutes away from Aghia Sofia, Top Kapi, Blue Mosque, Kinsterna, we didn't believe our luck. The staff is totally professional, helpful and polite. Between 5:00 and 7:00 p.m free tea, cake and biscuits are served in the bistro of the hotel where it's a great time to organize the plans for the night or the next day or catch your breath between the numerous sites you need to visit next ;) Free wi-fi in every room and place of the hotel gives one more touch to perfection. I cannot imagine staying at another hotel during my next visit in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel with the sights on your doorstep”
Reviews.Author: Lora_DXB
Reviews.Content: We arrived and were treated to a complementary welcome drink in the cool reception area, together with an introduction to Istanbul by the knowledgeable and friendly concierge, which was great to orientate ourselves. The rooms were a decent size, spotlessly clean and comfortable. We could hear a bit of noise on a morning from the breakfast room, but our rooms were on the 1st floor, otherwise it was a quiet hotel. Breakfast was great (tea, coffee, omelette, bread, cheese, fruit, cereal etc), plus they offer complementary tea/coffee and cake each evening from 5-7pm for hotel guests in the bistro which was a nice touch. The hotel is an easy 5-10 min walk up to the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofya, so location was great too. I would definitely recommend if you're looking for a friendly small/boutique style hotel in a quiet location, but within easy walking distance of the main sights in Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “seraglio, "somewhere to be in love"”
Reviews.Author: mohsen r
Reviews.Content: We stayed at seraglio hotel in our vacation for three days and I MUST SAY â€œeverything and everyone were so nice for a couple to have a romantic trip. The staffs were so kind and greeting and make us to feel as a very special guest. Although some of them do not speak English but they really tried to make a pleasant time for us. Very kind receptions helped us to spend a happy time in enjoyable places in Istanbul by offering us tours in some great neighborhoods. We stayed in the suite with the view of sultan ahmet mosque. Accessories where well arranged and the roomâ€™s environment was warm and beautiful. The trace is surprisingly big and besides the wonderful view of sultan ahmet mosque in the night, though the weather was a little cold we could not resist to enjoy the great balcony. Unexpectedly the suite was much more appreciable than what they have defined in their site. If you are looking for a hotel with a high level of cleanness, in my opinion you may have no choice, but to select seraglio. We checked the suite, buffet and restaurant very carefully but any kind of dirtiness didnâ€™t bother us. The staffs are so willing to help and if you need something they would make it ready as soon as possible. The breakfast buffet is so delicious and very diverse. Being served with such a pleasant meal, by smiling chef made our days. You would have few choices with the food in hotelâ€™s restaurant, especially if you were vegetarian, but the food quality is stunning. The neighborhood is filled with restaurants, tee houses and this makes that area memorable. Seraglio hotel has located in the middle of the ancient area of Istanbul so you can reach to 90% of the historical places in ten minutes. Walking to The blue mosque takes at last 5 minutes and there you can use public transportations, which costs very fair in Istanbul. We really enjoyed low price public transportation so near the hotel. As the hotel is only two years old, the cabs from taksim region do not know the hotelâ€™s address very well, and we were lost one night. But the great accessibility to the public transportations covers this problem. We spent our romantic vacation in the lovely seraglio hotel. Thanks to the best services there was no problem with the hotel to make us a little bit less happier, indeed made this trip the most memorable trip of our life. We recommend every young couple, if they wanna have comfortable, happy and loving moments in their vacation just try seraglio hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service and great location”
Reviews.Author: pinaryilmaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed close to 14 days at this hotel and I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is visiting Istanbul. Great customer service, genuine, friendly environment, safe, cosy, clean, local to tourist attractions and most importantly affordable... Would definitely come back and stay here

Reviews.Title: “Supreme hospitality”
Reviews.Author: JulianTreasure
Reviews.Content: Almost flawless. This small boutique hotel has spotless modern rooms (mine had a lovely view of the Green Mosque from the private balcony), excellent facilities throughout, including a good brasserie serving well-cooked food... and the kindest, most genuine welcome I can remember. As an example, on check in I was offered a tea or coffee while at the front desk. When I said I had two guests joining me for breakfast the next morning, the manager invited them to join in the buffet (including the omelet station) for no charge at all. Nothing was any trouble for the brilliant staff. It was snowing on my visit, but I reckon the balconies and roof terrace would be lovely in the summer. The location is ideal, amongst trendy high class shops in the old town and a short walk from many of the main attractions. If I had a small criticism, it would be the noisy air conditioning, which I had to keep on due to the cold outside. Otherwise, perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in Seraglio Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fairypk
Reviews.Content: This review is a little late, my husband and I stayed here in May for our honeymoon. We received excellent advice from the front desk regarding places to go siteseeing, the timings of places, restaurants to eat at and generally good tips on what to do. The breakfast was great and very lavish, we used to really fill ourselves up on eggs, bread, cheese, olives, coffee, cereal and everything else on offer. It's a cute small place with a friendly staff in the winding alleys of Sultanahmet, but it is a very easy walk to the metro stop so when you come back tired its not a long walk at all. I would look at some of the other hotels and would notice that they have a slightly longer walk from the metro station. The hotel was very close walking to Topkapi, Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern, Hagia Sophia, so wonderful location in Old City. It was peaceful in terms of location and all. Would totally recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Service”
Reviews.Author: Ghinwa O
Reviews.Content: Very good service. The front office manager was very friendly. The hotel is also very cozy.

Reviews.Title: “Second to none!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah M
Reviews.Content: Great atmosphere, service is wonderful, they really go the extra mile. Very central to Sultanahmet. Awesome breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Our Istanbul home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Kelly G
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (mum dad, 8 year old and toddler) had the most wonderful stay over five nights at Hotel Seraglio. The staff greeted us near midnight with hot tea and small gifts for our tired children, and we had the ground floor room with private courtyard. Just lovely. Breakfast is delicious, the location is easy walking distance to all the main sites, even with a stroller and in the unexpected Istanbul snow. Kenan, Grace says hello! You really made her stay with your warmth and humour. From the chef who made a swan out of an apple for our toddler, to the lovely cleaning staff who made up our room each day, not forgetting the included afternoon tea of cake and apple-tea and warm welcome home each day after our tourist adventures, Hotel Seraglio was perfect. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “what a lovely place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: jess m
Reviews.Content: The people at hotel Seraglio are extremely accommodating and warm in their approach to hospitality. The rooms are comfortable and the location is ideal - close walking distance to the Hagia Sophia and Blue mosque . I'd strongly recommend Hotel seraglio for anyone traveling to the beautiful city of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Everything a traveller needs!”
Reviews.Author: Jonathon N
Reviews.Content: The location was central to everything including the local attractions of Sultan Ahmet, as well as a short train ride to the Galatti Bridge and Grand Bazaar. The breakfast available was enjoyed every mourning and the afternoon tea and coffee was great too. Rooms were tidy and well-equipped, and most of all, the staff were extremely friendly and more than happy to help with any issues. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “extremely comfortable”
Reviews.Author: franco s
Reviews.Content: Rooms are always clean,staff is attentive and it is on a good location,we stayed here 3 nights,the bed was extremely comfortable,shower was wonderful,we love this place,highly recommend this hotel for every one.

Reviews.Title: “As good as its reviews”
Reviews.Author: Wanderers62
Reviews.Content: Chose the hotel based upon the exceptional reviews, and it lived up to expectations and more. Excellent location, comfortable room with excellent facilities for a small family run hotel, generous and varied food for breakfast (especially omelettes made to order) and friendly, helpful and knowledgable staff. Thanks to Kenan in particular for his warmth, humour and guidance on what to see and where to go to.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, great staff & breakfast”
Reviews.Author: SusanLinley
Reviews.Content: Hotel Seraglio is a nice, modern, quiet, clean and comfortable hotel. We totally had the 'cheap' room on the ground floor (hotels.com) and loved it. Nice breakfast spread with good coffee and great yogurt. Super comfy bed, spacious bathroom - newer and super clean.

Reviews.Title: “Terry F”
Reviews.Author: Terence F
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seraglio in August 2011 at the start of our holiday in Turkey. The hotel is small but ideally situated close to the Blue Mosque. You can walk every where in the old town. The staff were great, so helpful with advice. We wished we had more time there

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful for family of four!”
Reviews.Author: esdoan
Reviews.Content: Our family loved the Hotel Seraglio. It is totally small family owned meets luxury. The staff were amazing and so kind to our two kids. We stayed in the triple room (had a travel bed for our littlest) which was wonderful- the beds were so comfortable and we loved the down comforters. The breakfast was awesome. It is probably my favorite hotel in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Should be the model for all hotels”
Reviews.Author: Travellinganne1965
Reviews.Content: This hotel, the staff.. understands what friendly service, well appointed rooms and going the extra bit means to a traveler.. The breakfast buffet is incredible... the small bistro is good as well (especially after a long day of walking!) Internet is good..everything is awesome... This hotel would be my reason for returning to Istanbul... You guys are just fabulous... Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Good location and very friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Traveler44Chicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seraglio for three nights in mid December. It had been recommended by friends, and we were very pleased with it. The location is very convenient--within 10 minutes' walk to the the three major tourist sites in the old city (Aya Sofia, Topkapi Palace and Blue Mosque). The Grand Bazaar and the Suleiman Mosque are also within walking distance, and there is a tram line close by which can take you across the Golden Horn to the new city and Beyoglu. The rooms are clean and comfortable, and there is an excellent breakfast. The hotel also arranges for a car to pick you up at the airport, which first time visitors will find useful. Finally, the staff was very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and nice”
Reviews.Author: happy-felix
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in this hotel from 31 Dec till Jan 05. Everything was really great: location, our room (with hammam), breakfast and VERY helpful hotel team. Location is good, right in the historical center, on a calm street. This is an advantage. But it's also true that most of the locations and restaurants nearby are stricktly touristic (with a few good exceptions, follow the Lonelyplanet or hotel team advices). However, it's quite easy to rich Beyoglu, where the night life with bars and clubs is concentrated, by a tram or taxi. Taxi is quite chip. Sometimes it costs as public transportation. Value: definitely good ratio between price and quality. Although high season prices should be a less ;)

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Mirellise
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during our first few days in Istanbul and liked it so much that we changed our reservations at another hotel at the end of our trip in order to return to the Seraglio. The hotel is located on a relatively quiet street just a couple of blocks from the heart of Istanbul's main sites. This means that you can easily walk to all of the historic sights and mass transit hubs, while also benefiting from a quiet night's sleep. The hotel is very modern and recently updated. The rooms are a good size, functional, and comfortable. The bathroom was large and the shower was excellent. The wireless internet also worked well. Breakfast was served fresh every day and there was a very good variety of food availavable. The hotel also had a bar on premises and served snacks in the evening. The hotel staff were all very helpful and friendly, arranging airport transfers, recommending local restaurants, and engaging in conversation. Of all the places we've ever stayed during our various travels, this is one of the best hotels we've ever stayed. I would highly recommend this hotel to other travelers, and if we were to return to Istanbul, I would definitely return to the Hotel Seraglio.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Me-and-London
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel. The rooms are spotless clean, comfortable and quite; the breakfast is really really good; the staff is extremely helpful but at the same time not noisy or too pro-active; the quality of sleep is the best you can dream about. Absolutely nothing to complain about. Finally we found our place to stay in Istanbul every time we will be back

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Cruiser_Chris
Reviews.Content: A great location for tourists. Close to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and other Sultanahmet tourist sites. We stayed one night in a standard room on the main floor. Both the room and the bathroom were very well appointed with modern furnishings and a very comfortable bed. The charming bistro on the property was most welcome - who wants to go looking for a place to eat after a long flight? The buffet breakfast included in the room rate was fabulous. Everything about the Seraglio was perfect starting with the attentive English speaking staff and the offer of apple tea when we arrived. We just knew right away that we had made the right choice. If we are every lucky enough to be in Istanbul again, we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best boutique hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: SteveBari
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in over 1000 hotels for my job, I can say that all the good things that everyone says about this hotel are true. I don't believe it would be possible to find a better boutique hotel in Istanbul and I am certain that the quality/price ratio is one of the best in the world, not only in Istanbul. Often when you stay in small cheapish hotels there are one or two things which are a problem which you put up with because of the price. This is not the case with this hotel. It has no real faults. It has the best hotel bed I can remember sleeping in and even the food in their small Bistro is good. The personnel speak English and they recommend places to go to which are good, not because they are friends of theirs. If you can, stay in a deluxe room or one with the hamman, they are more spacious and well worth the extra few pounds you pay. You must also take advantage of their airport shuttle service. It costs a few pounds more than a taxi but what better way to start and end the holiday than being transported in luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Unique”
Reviews.Author: SheikhaCantabria
Reviews.Content: Location could not be better. Just a few minutes walk from the main sites in ild Istambul. We just spent two nights in a standard room. The room.was spotlessly clean. The bed.was amazingly comfortable. TV with many international channels. Safe. Tea maker. Desk. Bathroom.size was good with a big shower. Just a couple of shelves were missing to put out stuff and two bulbes were not working. Toiletries were good. The room.size was enough for a good night sleep. Window.with view to the patio. Extremely quiet. The.breakfast is just great! You can have a fresh omelette. Good variety... Just one thing: fresh orange juice is charged at 2euros... The staff are very kind and helpful. We were offered a welcome drink and there is a happy hour with complimentary drinks and muffins every evening. Tip: if you pay cash you get 7% discount. Euros are accepted as standard. They have a room with a hamman and.another.one.with big.terrace with great views. All booked... But standard room was superb! Thanks Seraglio!

Reviews.Title: “Best keep secret in Sultanamet!”
Reviews.Author: KimCanberra
Reviews.Content: We arrived before check in after a very long 19 hour flight from Australia, and even though they didn't have to, they had a room made up for us early. This hotel is fantastic. The staff were wonderful, the room was delightful, the bed one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in while travelling and the breakfast was to die for!! The hotel also [â€¦] has a happy hour where it supplies free tea and coffee and cakes, muffins etc. Why would you go anywhere else? We will definitely stay there again. Many thanks to Kenan for all his help and conversation!

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB - OUTSTANDING HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: testla
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seraglio Hotel for 4 nights in July 2011 and I'm ashamed it's taken so long to write a review. We arrived late afternoon and took advantage of the complimentary free transport that the hotel laid on from Ataturk Airport. On arrival and after checking in we were each treated to a cup of Turkish coffee and given a comprehensive briefing of the locality, recommended restaurants and advised of the best tours to be had in Istanbul. Our room, on the first floor, was absolutely charming; a huge room, with floor to ceiling windows and doors onto a lovely balcony with table and chairs overlooking the little courtyard, where we spent early mornings and evenings planning our sightseeing in this amazing city. Breakfast was perfect and set us up for 4 days of relentless exploring - the omelettes were wonderful! The location of the hotel was perfect - I am so glad that we didn't stay in Beyoglu as a lot of people recommended. As lively and interesting as it was, nothing could compare with the old city and it's superb restaurants and peaceful evening atmosphere. We took advantage of the complimentary tea and cakes late afternoon in the bistro part of the hotel. There is absolutely nothing to fault in this hotel - including the adorable kittens across the streeet. When we left were both given memento key rings - a wonderful touch. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to experience old Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, friendly, quiet & convenient”
Reviews.Author: Archinerds
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about our stay here: the location is perfect, on a quiet street two blocks from the Sultanahmet (Blue) Mosque, whose minarets we could see out our window; the room was surprisingly large and comfortable, especially for an old-quarter hotel, and the bathroom was shiny and modern; and most importantly, the staff were impeccable -- friendly and helpful and went out of their way to be of assistance and to make our stay special. We recommend them unconditionally.

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: pura_vida288
Reviews.Content: if you want to stay at a beautiful, charming little hotel in the old town of istanbul, this is your place! the staff is incredible helpful und friendly, the rooms are okay, the breakfast is great, everything recommandable. but the best thing is, itÂ´s located at the heart of the old town, where you can breathe the great history of this town. enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Memorable!”
Reviews.Author: Hintsandtips
Reviews.Content: A very relaxing experience. Great hospitable staff, great location in Old Istanbul, very clean room and bath, comfortable bed. Great balcony with the triple room we booked. Book through their website to make use of their offers: free airport pick up, cash discount. We received a warm welcome and early check in that we really appreciated. The buffet breakfast is great, very tasty and varied, served in a comfortable room, good variety of teas and great coffee. They also have complementary tea time in the afternoon. There are tea making facilities in the room, kettle, tea bags, sugar, for your convenience. Free wi-fi, but if you didn't bring your laptop there is a business desk in the small lobby area with a laptop. After a busy day you so look forward to coming home (always a good sign that you made the right choice). We checked into a bigger hotel after that and really regretted it. We missed our cozy room and unbeatable location. A really good neighborhood for eating out or just going for a walk, quite safe at night too. My favorite hotel so far. Will definitely visit Istanbul again but part of what made it special was Seraglio without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff in a great location for sightseeing and dining.”
Reviews.Author: chris_explorer
Reviews.Content: Seraglio staff were very courteous and helpful, providing great tips on places to see and do (kudos to Celal specially). The location is a convenient starting point for seeing the Old Istanbul sights and then dining out at the end of the day among the many eateries around it. The complimentary afternoon tea and pastries was a welcome respite. The rooms were clean and the hamam in the room was soothing and fun. Complimentary breakfast made for a great start to the day.

Reviews.Title: “RIGHT CHOICE!!”
Reviews.Author: jason p
Reviews.Content: Hotel Seraglio is the right place.It is a vey clean hotel in a superb location in the old city.It is also ten min. right to the city center(Taksim Sq).Staff speaks good English and very helpfull.You can see the manager (Cagri )all around in time.He gives good advice about Istanbul(listen to him!!)We ate a lot from the buffet breakfast cant be better in a such small hotel.We will definitely come back if we visit Istanbul again. P.S They have good promotions on their own site,such as free ride from the airport which was very useful.

Reviews.Title: “Beryl Pallin”
Reviews.Author: Beryl P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel from 20th - 30th October 2011. It is impecably clean and comfortable. All staff are well-trained, friendly and helpful. It is ideally situated. Buffet breakfast was excellent, complete with home-made pastries and preserves. Having travelled extensively , this is the first time I have known m husband to give a hotel top ranking in all categories.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Sami1111
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Istanbul staying in a small boutique hotel. Seraglio is a wonderful hotel. Very clean, and a very nice and comfortable room. The location is excellent. A couple of minutes away from the Blue mosque, and a number of good restaurants at the end of the street. Our flights arrived very early and departed late at night; The gave us an early check-in and a very late check-out. The staff were very helpful: efficient service and helped us planning our daily trips. We are staying there again during our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff!”
Reviews.Author: jst20b
Reviews.Content: Kenan and Celal could not have been more welcoming and helpful. The Seraglio is in a perfect location for a weekend of sightseeing. Our room was spotless, the mattress was great, and thanks to those on Trip Advisor who advised booking a Hamman room! Very generous breakfast and perfect wifi connection. We hope to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Family Run Hotel....”
Reviews.Author: kevin e
Reviews.Content: we had a great time at Seraglio.Excellent location at Sultanahmet area close to main points and silent, safe at night. It was very clean, not to big but nice and good shaped rooms. Staff was very helpful.It says Family Home at their card and they gave us that feeling.Rich breakfast buffet .Tea time was a nice touch after walking all day at the old city. Homemade cakes cookies free with tea or coffee.We would definitely come back if we can visit Istanbul again...

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended! Best small hotel this world traveler has stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Alan F
Reviews.Content: The location is great for walking to all of the sights in Suhantamet and near the light rail line. The staff went above and beyond at every opportunity. My laptop charger quit working and when I asked about an Apple store, they didn't have one but loaned me the charger from their laptop for the duration of my stay. On a second occasion they called for a taxi for me to go to pick up my fiancÃ©e at the airport and in my excitement, I left my iPhone in the cab. One phone call back to the hotel and they contacted the cab co. and had my phone back at the hotel before I arrived back from the airport. The breakfast was Nice, fresh and had omelette's made to order. The room, although small, which can be expected in such an historic district was perfect in every manner. Spotlessly clean, nice amenities and extremely quiet and comfortable. My only regret was they were sold out for the last part of our stay and we moved to another hotel and paid 3 Times the price for a dirty room and mediocre staff. (Best Western Acropol). I will definitely return to Istanbul and stay at this superior property!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms with superb stuff!”
Reviews.Author: Onur D
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience in Seraglio Hotel with my fioncÃ¨.This hotel is like a heaven.The best thing was the room had a Hamam.It was definetely perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Turkey!”
Reviews.Author: Sally W
Reviews.Content: We have been traveling in Turkey for almost a month and can honestly say that this was the very best hotel we had! It was so convenient to so many of Istanbul's wonderful sights, and the staff could not have been more helpful or accommodating. After a day of hustle-bustle sight-seeing in a very busy city, Seraglio was like coming home to a lovely little oasis, being greeted by a family member. It was very nice to have the option to eat at their lovely outdoor bistro rather than going out in the crowds again. A truly wonderful place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel with amazing staff!”
Reviews.Author: ljkraj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the H. Seraglio twice during our visit to Turkey. It is the perfect choice for anyone visiting Istanbul. It is just 5 minutes from the Blue Mosque and is in an ideal location to walk to many of the sights. The rooms are extremely clean, have modern baths and are very comfortable. The staff though is what makes this hotel perfect! Everyone is so friendly and helpful. The breakfast each morning was delicious! One of our best in Turkey! We also had the opportunity to have one dinner here and it was exceptional as well. We can't wait to return to Istanbul and will absolutely stay here again. We would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Friendly & Good location”
Reviews.Author: michael w
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for our honeymoon. Good location and the staffs are always very helpful. I do has asthma but I found the room be very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Jewel in Sultanahmet!.....”
Reviews.Author: Sandy V
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a quiet, well-located, super-friendly boutique hotel with ample sized, clean modern rooms (some with a view of the Blue Mosque!) and fabulous, attentive staff, look no further! We used TripAdvisor to source out the Seraglio & were extremely impressed with the whole experience! To start with, we arrived @ 10a.m. (way before check-in time), but our rooms (we were 2 couples traveling) had vacated, so the nice front desk man invited us to relax in their open-air restaurant (which turns into a cozy, raki bar at nite!) with a beverage while the housekeeping staff whipped up our rooms in no time! Talk about service right off the bat! The staff were also helpful in booking us into a Turkish Dance Show and arranging all transportation during our stay. The breakfasts were some of the best we've ever had in Europe (over the years, we've been to more than 14 European countries, some numerous times) and our rooms were extremely well kept, clean and totally comfortable. Oh, and if you wanted to sleep thru the 6:15a.m. 'call to prayer' over the loudspeakers from the nearby Blue Mosque, simply close the windows (they appear to be sound-proof!)and let the AC do its magic! Now that we know our way around this beautiful city, when we return, we would definitely stay in the Sultanahmet area, and very definitely at the Seraglio Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, comfortable hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: 154945John
Reviews.Content: Near the Blue Mosque (in fact we had a great view of it from the deck on our very comfortable room), this warm and welcoming hotel had everything we wanted. On a quiet street in Sultanahmet, the Seraglio is handy to most of Istanbul's major attractions. The hotel staff were friendly, approachable and very helpful. The breakfast was fine and the free afternoon tea was a nice touch. The short walk from the hotel to the Sultanahmet tram stop takes you past the Arasta Bazaar (nice stuff), the Blue Mosque, and Hagia Sophia. It made for a great start and end to each amazing day in this incredible city. When we return to Istanbul, we will stay here again. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lucy B
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week, arriving on our 21st wedding anniversary and were welcomed as if it were our honeymoon. The front desk staff were so helpful - we had a complimentary taxi meet us at the airport and were given lots of helpful information on arrival. The hotel is brilliantly situated near some of the major attractions, but is in a fairly quiet street. The breakfasts are very good indeed with a range of fresh fruit, traditional Turkish breakfast such as cheeses, hams, pastries, and also freshly cooked omelette. The complimentary tea and cakes in the afternoon was also a very welcome treat. We had the Hammam Suite. Our room was quite small but not poky and had lots of cupboard space, a kettle with tea and coffee and was attractively furnished. The shower incorporated a Hammam and it was wonderful to lie down on the (permanently) heated marble bench and relax after a hard day's walking! If I had one critisism it would be that the pillows could have been of slightly better quality, but this is really nit picking. I would definitely stay at the Seraglio again.

Reviews.Title: “awesome place to stay”
Reviews.Author: talha a
Reviews.Content: if ur in istanbul than u gotta stay in sultan ahmet district, and there u should stay at seraglio hotel i stayed for a week so i got free mini van pick up to and from the airport, and it was private van. the location of the hotel is awesome this is heart of istanbul all shops, cafes, and hotels around, very close to blue mosque, aya sofia, and topkapi palace all walking distance closest being blue mosque hotel is small, very well equipped strong signal for wifi , good breakfast but limited, good rooms, i had a room with turkish bath it was awesome, room service daily, very helpful managers at reception, safe and sound hotel, laundry is available at low rate, i would stay there again. i got this after chekcing like 25 other hotels in this area , enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, a very good deal”
Reviews.Author: LindaPetzold
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights. The staff was the most friendly and helpful we have ever experienced. Breakfast was good, including eggs made to order. Room was modern and large, with a reasonably comfortable bed. The hotel is very well-located with respect to the major tourist attractions. With four night stay or more, they provide complimentary private transportation from the airport!

Reviews.Title: “for Sultanahmet, a very good deal”
Reviews.Author: CavKA
Reviews.Content: firstly, a bit about staying in Istanbul if you have not visited. Sultanahmet is where most of the really big tourist attractions are so it is also where you will be bumping into hundreds of tourists. It is crowded, food is substandard and there is a hotel about every 2 feet. If you do opt for one of the terraces, be expected to pay a lot for very little quality. Since I have been to Istanbul before, my decision would be (next time) to stay on the other side of town where there are much more interesting going out places and where you actually have a chance to meet people from Istanbul. If you have never been here before, then okay you may wish to stay here but then do get on the tram and head to the other areas of Istanbul to go out as this side of town is a total rip off and the food (almost without exception) is not of good quality and much more expensive. But if you do opt to stay here, this hotel is a nice choice. It is reasonable, comparatively. We payed â‚¬119 a night for what is a standard room, which was fine. Not huge rooms but do able. There is a good bathroom, a wardrobe, a safe and a mini bar. There is free wi fi and a computer to use in the lobby if you don't bring yours. Breakfast is fine, served in the basement or you can take out to the cafe which is open. There is no terrace but you can find plenty of places that have one to get the view. Staff are very friendly. They offer a free transfer (one way) to their hotel if you are staying 2 or 3 nights. We were met but waited a bit to leave. I think next time, we would just do a taxi. It is only between 35-55 turkish lira (divide by 4 for Euro and a little over 5 for US dollars) so not much. Ride to hotel was about 30-40 minutes. Only complaint about hotel when we went was a bit of noise. They are doing construction on hotel across the road and they did it at really bad hours (early and late). Finally, one tip. If you are departing internationally, check in on line and print your boarding pass when you leave. Ataturk airport is a zoo at almost anytime in the international departures and if you need to check in you MUST give yourself at least 2.5 hours there. There are multiple security checks and the check in lines are long. Whereas if you check in on line, then you will reduce your time greatly (there were only 2 people in line in front). it is only one counter, so you will need to look. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 33231Henry
Reviews.Content: We stayrd two nights in this wonderful hotel. Just two or three blocks from the Blue Mosque and the center of the old town. The staff could not have been nicer-helped us with tiur information and a ride to the airport. We would definately stay here again. Also. the room was quite nice with two beds, quite adequate in size. Breakfast was the real suprise. Full brekfast with fried eggs service was a great way to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Keith M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seraglio Hotel for six nights and found it a perfect base for our vacation. It describes itself as a `family home in the heart of Old Istanbul' and fully lives up to that billing. The hotel is within a short walking distance of all the main sights. The rooms were very comfortable and well-appointed. We particularly enjoyed sitting on the terrace overlooking the inner courtyard at night in the moonlight.There was an excellent buffet breakfast and complementary tea in the late afternoon. But what really makes the Hotel Seraglio a great choice is the staff who couldn't have been more friendly and helpful especially given our late arrival and early departure. I cannot recommend the Seraglio highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: NellyCT52
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on three different nights in April 2011. Close to everything in the historic district. Clean,very comfortable,modern rooms. The staff,however,is extraordinarily accommodating and what makes Seraglio the gem it is. When our taxi to the airport failed to show, the gentlemen at the hotel arranged for a friend to come get us- for free. I was happy the taxi finally arrived as I didn't want to impose on these generous people. But that is how they are. You can always find a bigger, better, fancier hotel but you will not beat their sincere generosity and interest in making your trip to Istanbul as nice as it can be. Great breakfast with something for everyone, enough to keep the most fearless tourist going all day. And cake and tea/coffee in the afternoon too! Can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly place”
Reviews.Author: brenan p
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seraglio Hotel with our son,the place is very clean and the staff is very friendly,great location and close to the centre,the rooms are very quiet and comfortable,very pleasent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! So glad we discovered it!”
Reviews.Author: FarhanAhmed
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Seraglio for 10 days in August 2011. Stumbled upon them on a web search by chance, which ended up being the proverbial cherry on our fantastic turkey vacation. Right from the time we arrived at Seraglio (from a rather unpleasant immigration experience) at the Attaturk Airport, we were taken care of fabulously by the extremely polite & thoughtful staff. Upon asking if we were up for iton arrival, the front desk explained the geographical spread of Turkey on a map, pointing out the key attractions and must try restaurants. We were even provided a proper handout of opening/closing timings of key attractions along with the days they were closed, which came in very handy. The hotel is located somewhat close to the main attractions of Old Istanbul, The Blue Mosque & Hagia Sofia. There is, however, a bit of an uphill walk to both of these [roughly 5 minutes] so it didnt matter much to us [note: make sure you pack comfortable walking shoes before coming to Istanbul! Slippers/FlipFlops will literally kill you!] . The nearest tram station is also roughly 5-7 minutes away, from where you can go almost anywhere in Istanbul. The room was clean & very functional, with a spacious wardrobe, safe & mini bar. Having requested a smoking room, we had an adjoining balcony for smoking which kept the room smelling of stale cigarettes. The bathroom was immaculately pristine and almost looked brand new, much to our joy! Though we didnt eat much on the hotel premises during the day, the breakfast (inclusive in the room rate) was fantastic, with a wide selection of cereals, fruits, hot and cold drinks as well as an egg station. Seraglio also upped the game by offering free evening tea and snacks from 5:00pm to 7:00pm to all its guests, which we availed when we werent out exploring the city. However, I feel the strongest point of Seraglio is its staff. Having travelled quite a bit including to the far east which is famed for its hospitality, I have never experienced the kind of service that we experienced at our stay at Seraglio. Kenan & Celal at the front desk & the housekeeping & bistro staff went out of their way to make sure we were taken care of, with their recommendations of restaurants, providing directions to obscure places, loaning us travel guidebooks for the day, referring us to travel agents for exploring trips to cappadocia & pamukale, arranging airport transfers etc etc. In short, Seraglio probably ranks as one of the best hotels we've ever stayed at. Personally, I have never writted a review on TripAdvisor before but after the brilliant experience at Seraglio, I was compelled to. The next time we go to Istanbul [and I know we will], I will chose Seraglio without a doubt. It was one of the highlights of our vacation, and in a great city like Istanbul, thats saying something.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful introduction to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: gardenOttawa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Seraglio for 4 nights with our four children and loved every minute. The hotel is situated perfectly to walk to all the major sites. The rooms were clean and very comfortable, and in particular, we loved the blue mosque suite with its' balcony overlooking the Blue Mosque. We really enjoyed thier outdoor terrace where we would sit and have a drink or snacks and look and listen to the sights and sounds of Istanbul. The staff were very friendly and helpful and they put on a great breakfast in the am. We also enjoyed the return airport transportation and 10% discount if rooms are paid for in cash. All in all, a perfect choice for our familys' first trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: djlee79
Reviews.Content: I recommend that you check out the hotel website to see if any promotions are being offered before looking at the 3rd party sites such as booking.com. For my booking, the hotel was offering a free airport transfer to or from Ataturk if you stayed 4 nights or more. They also offer a 5% cash payment discount. The staff at the hotel are young, friendly, and helpful. Upon arrival, we were greeted and offered beverages. They did a great job in showing us things to do in the hotel area and gave their recommendations. The free breakfast was impressive. There is a mix of different beverages, various baked goods, fruits, hot foods like eggs, sausages, cheese rolls, and even have an omlette station where someone will make it on request! The hotel is about a 5 minute walk from major attractions like the blue mosque and hagia sofia. It's also close to the water where you can take a stroll along the sea wall. A tram station is within 10 minutes which can take you to most areas you'll want to see.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: scarletlettera
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hammam room for 2 nights when we first arrived in Istanbul. Room was clean and spacious. Enjoyed using the private Turkish Bath after a long day of siteseeing. Very well situated to visit the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and Topkapi Palace. The staff were friendly and ernest. However, they had difficulty with giving recommendations for local restaurants to try. Overall a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location and rooms!”
Reviews.Author: adambotha
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Seraglio for 9 nights in late June 2011. Due to our length of stay we were entitled to a free airport transfer. From the moment we landed in Istanbul to the second we left, Hotel Seraglio and its staff did everything they could to ensure our stay was enjoyable and hassle-free. Firstly it is perfectly located for sightseeing, with most of the major tourist sites within easy walking distance. It's also a short distance from a couple of tram stations allowing cheap and easy travel to other areas of Istanbul. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Especially Kenan, the front desk manager, who's advice was always spot-on and was always ready to help with any questions. We stayed in a standard room for the majority of our stay, and the hamam superior room for a couple of nights. Both rooms were spotlessly clean, light, quiet and comfortable. Istanbul is an amazing city, and our stay in this city was further enhanced by an excellent hotel with great staff offering good value. I would recommend Hotel Seraglio to anyone travelling to Istanbul without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at a lovely place; really nice staff”
Reviews.Author: lostintranslation17
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Istanbul Seraglio for three nights at the end of July and the area was really nice, full of nice restaurants. The hotel room (304) was new, had a very spacious bathroom and shower and great AC (it was hot in Istanbul!). People at the hotel were very nice and helpful. Would stay there again if we come visit Istanbul. Enjoyed the breakfast and the location. Recommend it!"

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY!!!! what a service!!”
Reviews.Author: poppis80
Reviews.Content: Will be there again!!!breakfast was good and service was excellent! room was clean and spacious.bathroom was stale mornings if door was closed but it was no big problem.distance to aya sofya and blue mosque was about 300m.Tesekkuler Seraglio hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: fromMTL
Reviews.Content: The staff at the desk was excellent, providing advice and commentary when requested. Great location, particularly if this is your first time in Istanbul and would like to see the key sights â€” for instance, Seraglio Hotel is just 5 minutes' walk from the Blue Mosque, and easy walking distances to Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Palace. Good selection at the breakfast buffet - the omelette station is a nice touch. Bright clean room overlooking the hotel's inner courtyard, and spotless bathroom with the expected toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and friendly”
Reviews.Author: marcellino37
Reviews.Content: Hotel Seraglio is perfectly located, very near the main monuments but in quiest and pleasant street. The rooms are very confortable and spacious. However, the best thing is the friendly atmosphere of the hotel itself and its nabourhood. It was really enjoible to get back after one day of exploring Istanbul. Everyone in the hotel is friendly and very helpfull. Everything was arranged perfectly. I would really love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great value. Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: HistoryGuy1517
Reviews.Content: The hotel wasn't the easiest to find (even for the taxi driver), but it is very close to the Blue Mosque and AyaSofia. There are lots of shopping and eating opportunities nearby. The staff speaks English well and are very helpful. The free internet in the lobby worked well. The cafe is rather small but the food was very good. The room was spacious, clean, and comfortable. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: jollies_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights in June and completely agree with all the positive comments that this hotel quite rightly receives. All staff are friendly and helpful and the free airport transfer service, welcome drink and useful overview of the city upon arrival were much appreciated. Rooms are clean and modern and breakfast selection is very good. The hotel is in an ideal location for sightseeing with good transport links to other parts of the city close by. Would definitely stay here again during our next visit to this fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms, great staff”
Reviews.Author: chicken_features
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at night after a long bus ride and received the most cheerful greeting and a welcome drink straight away. The staff were all very friendly and helpful throughout our 4 night stay. We were told on arrival that the room we were booked into needed some renovation on the last day of our stay, so we were upgraded for our last night. I'm not sure what the renovations were, as the room seemed fine (apart from being a little bit noisy as it was on the ground floor near the stairwell) . But both rooms we stayed in were fantastic. Spacious, comfortable beds, choice of pillows, large bathroom, fast wireless internet... The breakfast was also good with plenty of choice and omelets made to order. The free "tea-time" in the evening was a nice bonus too. We paid cash on arrival and received a 10% discount and a free transfer to the airport when we left. The location is perfect for exploring Istanbul's sights - all in all, we were very happy with our stay here and would definitely recommend it to others!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Hobartgirl
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights and then back for one more at this hotel. Very friendly and helpful staff. Room was large. I had the hamman room and while it takes time to heat it was great when it does. Maybe some instructions on how to do your own turkish bath would be handy. Room was clean and the bathroom was modern. Lots of TV stations but only a couple were English speaking. Close to the main sights of Istanbul. Free internet in the lobby. Breakfast was good with an omlette made to order.

Reviews.Title: “On a scale 1 to 5, It's a 6!!”
Reviews.Author: H_and_M_Family
Reviews.Content: After seven days at the hotel, with a family of 2 adults and 2 children (5,5 and 1,5 years old) we can only summarize the entire experience as, Excellent! Like I stated in the headline, on a scale from 1 to 5, it's a 6!! Why a six you might ask? Let me tell you. 1. Super friendly, caring and nice staff. They were always smiling, helping out and just making sure we feelt at home and at ease. With a family with two small children, it's a challenge with almost everything you undertake. At Seraglio they made us feel at home. Nothing was too difficult to help us out with. 2. Super nice rooms. Clean, modern, spacious and just perfect. Free Wi-Fi, nice double bed, air condition working perfect with adjustable temperature, very clean and very nice bath rooms, different kinds of pillows to choose from etc. etc. 3. Location. Super good location. Minutes of walking to the most interesting sights. Overall, I'd visit the hotel again and I'd recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone whoâ€™s looking for a super good hotel which is both comfortable and reliable!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnWByrd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seraglio for 4 nights in early June 2011. Quite simply it is a superb hotel in all ways. The rooms are clean and comfortable. All of the staff are very friendly and helpful. The location is great for tourists (e.g., an easy 10 minute walk to the Blue Mosque). There are lots of restaurants in the neighborhood (though these tend to have close to European prices). The several we tried were all excellent. There was very good breakfast, a computer in the lobby for e-mail and wifi in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: mpierce64
Reviews.Content: The good: The room size was more than fine and the room was clean. The bathroom was a good size with a large shower. The air-conditioning worked well and overall the staff was nice. Free wifi. The ok: The location is in a very touristy area, which i thought would be good and may be good for some. But maybe because it's a touristy area of maybe because it's Istanbul, every shop owner and restaurant waiter haggles with you and borderline harasses you wherever you walk in the area. The location is quite close to the Hagia Sofia, Cistern, Topkapi and Blue mosque but you could take a cab/tram there from somewhere else for a day and sightsee and then spend the rest of your time in the city elsewhere. The bad: Hard to put my finger on. I think everyone meant well at the hotel but after a while I just got the feeling that everything they told me was wrong. Here are some examples. My first night I asked the gentleman at the desk to make a dinner reservation for me at 10 PM, which he told me was too late. I said that I didn't realize people ate so early in Istanbul and he said that it was not healthy to eat late and made the reservation for 9. Later, when taking a cab to the restaurant, I asked for the address to be written down for me. A different gentleman assured me that he told the cab driver and the cab driver knew exactly where the restaurant was and everything was taken care of so there was no need to write anything down. Well the cab driver dropped us in the wrong place and, despite searching and asking directions (using only the restaurant name) for 30 minutes, we gave up. Ok, I wasn't happy but let it go because mistakes happen. The same day I asked for laundry to be sent. I was told it would be ready the next day. It wasn't, and came back the following day right before I had to leave. When the gentleman at the desk gave it to me, he said, "it has nothing to do with me." I thought this was a rather strange yet inappropriate response. When I asked if the payment could be paid with credit card, he said no and again repeated, "it has nothing to do with me." Maybe it was a language or a cultural thing, but overall all of this added up and left a bad taste in my mouth. Overall: The rooms were nice and clean, the price was right and everyone I think meant well but I probably wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: GloballySwiss
Reviews.Content: New and clean rooms, good breakfast, friendly and helpful staff. Located in Sultanahmet, within walking distance of some of the city's most famous sites. Plenty of decent restaurants nearby. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and welcoming atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: HowardWisconsin
Reviews.Content: The Seraglio is excellently located in the Sultanahmet (Old City) section of Istanbul, close to the Blue Mosque. All the employees were extremely nice and helpful and the two major front desk managers were full of good advice and ideas. A lovely hotel (great breakfast included).

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: rickityruckus
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful small hotel in a perfect area. Everything was meticulous. The room was very comfortable and more than functional. Our hosts were amazing and went out of their way to meet all of our needs and guide us through our stay, from arranging taxi rides to advising on the best places to go, and helping us with our Turkish pronunciations. They saved me by sending a taxi to the airport with my hand bag when I left it before our departure. It contained my passport! We highly recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised......superb hospitality and service”
Reviews.Author: Ashish1604
Reviews.Content: We checked in late in the eve after a long international flight and we were greeted warmly with a welcome drink. They even offerred to take our bags to the room. Another surprise was when we went up to our room and realised that we had been upgraded to a suite. This is a beautiful small hotel near the Blue Mosque with an excellent breakfast spread and superb service. Any time of the day the manager at the desk was willing to go out of his way to help. Its quite accessible from the near tram station. However coming from the airport I would recommend that one should use the shuttle or private transfer rather than the tram route. Thanks to all at Seraglio to make our stay wonderful!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Wgtn_NZ
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is in a great location for all the important sites. It is easy to walk to most and the tram is also close. There are several parks nearby and the Arasta Bazaar good for shopping. We enjoyed the hotel, and the private Hamman in our room was lovely...once we knew how to use it! The breakfast is extensive, the staff friendly and helpful. It is quiet at night but around the corner plenty of places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem in the heart of Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: HeatherTad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Seraglio for four nights on a recent trip to Istanbul. The accommodations were wonderful! The rooms were very clean, the bathroom amenities were similar to what you would find in the states (toilet, sink,enclosed shower, etc.). Breakfast was included with the nightly rate and it was fabulous. Everything from Turkish tea and coffee to an omelet station, fresh fruit, breads, pastries, etc. There was also a daily "tea time" for two hours in the evening with complementary fruit, breads and drinks (non-alcoholic). Because we stayed at the hotel for four nights and booked through their hotel website, we received a one-way transfer to the hotel. All of the major attractions were within walking distance such as the Blue Mosque Hagia Sophia, Palace, Basillica Cistern, Bosphorus Cruise, Grand Bazaar, Spice Market, etc. Kenan, the main contact at the hotel, was extrememly friendly and helpful in booking anything that we desired from restaurants to airport shuttles to a last-minute trip to Cappadocia. His English is very good. The only downfall was the 5 AM walk-up call that we received due to close proximity to the Blue Mosque (first morning call for prayer) but, I don't think it can be avoided in Istanbul due to the high number of mosques. I actually started sleeping through it after the first couple of nights. I will definitely stay at Hotel Seraglio during any future trips to Istanbul and would recommend it to anyone! Great value for the price!!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern boutique hotel in the old town of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Karslima
Reviews.Content: Hotel Seraglio is centrally located in the Sultanhamet district of Istanbul. The Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern and Topkapi Palace are all within a walking distance from the hotel and from each other. It is a good 20 minute or more leisurely walk from the hotel to the Spice market and the Grand Bazaar. It is also very close to many restaurants and cafes. The rooms and the bathrooms are very clean and spacious. The hotel serves a hearty breakfast and afternoon tea. The staff was very helpful and conscientious (check-in and check-out was very efficient as well). If you need it, they also have a very good wi-fi connection. Istanbul itself is easy to get around by taxi or tram. We took public transportation to go to the newer part of the city (i.e Taksim Square, Beyoglu, etc.) where there are many more dining and shopping options. The newer part of Istanbul is approximately 15-20 minute ride from the hotel by taxi or tram depending on traffic and whether or not it's rush hour. We had an enjoyable and relaxing stay at the Seraglio and if our travels bring us back to Istanbul, we will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful warm, friendly, comfortable, and a great location!”
Reviews.Author: billscottKalamazoo
Reviews.Content: We selected Hotel Seraglio after reading Trip Advisor reviews and we weren't disappointed. The location is perfect---close to the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia, but on a side street so there is little traffic at night. The only thing that woke us was the call to prayer---very exotic and moving. The staff couldn't be better. My friend's birthday occured during our visit. The staff planned a surprise cake and celebration for her. We were overwhelmed. The staff also directed us to good restaurants and tours. They couldn't have been nicer. Rooms were very, very clean and comfortable. There was a good shower (always a concern) and the bed was very comfortable. The breakfast was the same each day, but the quality of the food was good. All-in-all, I wouldn't stay anywhere else if and when I return to Istanbul. One tip--If you book directly through the hotel, the hotel will arrange airport pick up and drop off at no extra charge, much appreciated after a long trip from the States.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel.. highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Suldan054
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, friendly and helpful staff, convenient location - just a 5 minutes walk from major attractions in Istanbul. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wishes to explore Istanbul. Don't forget to ask hotel staff recommendations on city tours. In short, this is home away from home.. with a Turkish Tea! and they have the best lemonade juice in there!

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE ROOM â€“ COZY BISTRO â€“ FRIENDLY CREW !!”
Reviews.Author: Adrian73Torrini
Reviews.Content: This hotel wasnâ€™t my first choice but after reading the reviews I was confident in changing to SERAGLIO. I prefer a small boutique hotel and this one didnâ€™t let us down for the six nights we were there. I booked the airport transfer, which after a 12 hour flight, was appreciated to get off the plane and walk straight to the car without any delays. Upon arriving at the hotel we were greeted with a small stylish lobby that was warm and cozy. Our room was spacious, with a comfy bed with luxurious linen and the room had lots of windows for natural light and air. The bathroom was also roomy and clean. The staff at the hotel were polite and friendly and happy to help with any questions. We had an evening meal here and again we were not disappointed, so I can highly recommend it. If I return to Istanbul, The SERAGLIO will be my first hotel of choice, as we couldnâ€™t fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Great service/ location...but nicer options exist”
Reviews.Author: Travelaround2009
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Seraglio...the staff were very attentive and the location was great for exploring historic Istanbul. That said, the room (while a nice size) was nothing special and there was no sound barrier from the street. If you book in advance, you can find a nicer option (Amira, Senatus, etc) for the same price. I wouldn't recommend against the hotel, but we'll probably try a different option on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “excellent, well located boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: GEOMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and informative staff. Excellent location close to the major sights of Istanbul. Would recommend this if you want personal service, a quite and small hotel, well located. Would not suit the 5 star devotees but much better than that because it is small and well located. Our room was small but totally adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service right in middle of the Old City”
Reviews.Author: curious_explorer_66
Reviews.Content: The staff are courteous and very helpful. On my arrival, I was given a warm welcome and the manager gave me a map of Istanbul with recommendation of places to visit and eat. The hotel rooms are clean and the shower is nice. The only critical comment I have is the bed. Perhaps I am used to a standard of very high quality beds, but I found my sleep less than satisfactory because the beds are not comfortable. If they upgrade their beds, they would be a near perfect hotel to stay in Sultanahmet. Nevertheless, I had a very good stay in Istanbul because of Seraglio.

Reviews.Title: “charming hotel,not to be missed”
Reviews.Author: Zojay
Reviews.Content: five star hospitality of this hotel,combined with great comfort and amazing location adds to being in this charming city

Reviews.Title: “our lovely room with a view”
Reviews.Author: Lula52
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Blue Mosque suite. The terrace is spacious and furnished just as it appears on the website. Even though the weather was mixed I so enjoyed just having the door open a lot! Had a sunny day when I read my book lying on the swing....so relaxing! Room and bathroom spotless, bed comfy and large. Breakfast offered a big choice, complimentary tea in the afternoon much appreciated as was room service...no need to starve! Best of all were the staff who made us feel so at home and could advise us about tours, transport etc. Thanks Celal and Kenan. I hope we'll meet again one day.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent staff. Ideal location. Very comfort hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brazucanomundo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at Sultanameht, close to Blue Mosque. The staff is amazing, the room is very comfortable and clean. The breakfast is good, the area is perfect, you feel at home. We stayed at ground floor and there was a engine running little noisy, maybe the elevatorÂ´s engine. But the other aspects was so amazing that i rate it excellent. Stay here if possible.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the heart of Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Joao_Marcos
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and found it just memorable. I decided to book 3 rooms at Seraglio after reading a lot of good reviews and I definitely didn't get disappointed! It's a small hotel and we got a whole floor just for the six of us. It's located within walking distance of the main attraction in the European part of the city such as the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Basilica Cistern, Topkapi Palace and the Grand Bazaar, if you don't mind walking a little bit more. The rooms were spacious, well furnished, comfortable and had a strong and warm shower. The free breakfast included a variety of bread, cheese and ham, juice, cereals, coffee and cooked-to-order omelets. Let the Turkish hospitality surprise you too at Seraglio, and for sure this will help overcome any language barrier that may exist.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect combination!!”
Reviews.Author: nadser_2011
Reviews.Content: I was in Istanbul on a business trip. Seraglios' staff helped me to combine my business and free time. The room was clean, comfortable and quiet which enabled me to finish my work after my meetings/relax after a sight-seeing tour. I intend to return again on a vacation. I sure hope to stay here again and be greeted by the always smiling, friendly and helpful staff. When I am back i will try one of the lovely sounding dishes on the Bar Menu - didn't make make it this time :( Good luck & see u soon

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful trip”
Reviews.Author: JanneSwe
Reviews.Content: Our trip couldnâ€™t have started better when getting briefed by Celal (one of the extremely friendly staff members of the hotel) about Istanbul and the hotel itself, In order to make the best out of our short trip to this wonderful city. No matter what question we had, each one of the staff members was more than willing to help. Also, getting a wonderful breakfast in the morning with a variety of delicious food made us have a perfect start into each of our days. Thank you very much for making our stay in Istanbul unforgettable!

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: RedK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week in April 2011. The room was clean and comfortable, The staff was attentive and friendly. I stayedi n room 201, a deluxe room with 2 small balconies overlooking the inner courtyard. It looked exactly like the pictures on their website. The buildings on both sides are under construction, so an afternoon nap is not possible right now. Hopefully that will be done soon so visitors can sleep. I had a great time there and would stay in it again.

Reviews.Title: “a great choice in terms of location, cleanliness and a staff that make you feel like at home”
Reviews.Author: segredod
Reviews.Content: We stayed ten days in this outstanding boutique hotel and enjoyed its excellent location at the heart of Sultanahmet and its immaculate, well lighted, spacious and quiet double room. It has to be stressed the high professional level of its very friendly and helpful staff. In particular the manager and owner Cagri Yilmaz always attentive to our needs, the attentionate and efficient Kenan and Gelal, at the front office, but also all the people who assisted us, included Ali, Metin, Mehmet and Cengiz. Breakfast was very good and, with the complimentary afternoon tea with cake make this hotel a very good value. Their objective is to be â€œa family home...â€� and it is true that they make you feel more within family than in a business/like hotel. It was a great choice for a memorable stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with good service”
Reviews.Author: MagnusTheTraveler
Reviews.Content: I can only agree with previous reviews - this place is really nice! The hotel is located in an area with mostly hotels and restaurants in the very center of the old city of Istanbul. The blue mosque is 5 minutes walk away, most attractions in old town is within 15 minutes walking distance. The prayer calls from the blue mosque is heard very clearly (first call at 6 in the morning) but this is hard to avoid if you want to live in the old town since there are mosques all over the place and to me just added to the atmosphere! The rooms are fair sized with comfortable bed fresh modern bathroom/shower and have efficient and quiet heating / cooling system, electric teapot, and safety deposit box. The reception staff was very helpful, the breakfast bufe was nice (but fresh squeezed juice in 2 euro a glass - this should really be included since the place is not really budget). The complimentary afternoon tea with home made cookies is a nice touch. The hotels restaurant was clean but need more Turkish dishes (now more than half the menu is european turist food). The only negative things I can say about the hotell is the limited number of English language TV-channels (but who cares for TV in Istanbul anyhow!) and that one of the people in the staff recomended the nearby "fish house" that turned out to be a complete tourist trap with very inflated prices - avoid to all cost if you stay here - a better choice is for instance "Ocean's Seven Restaurant" (not located in the hotel with the same name but on a nearby street).

Reviews.Title: “Helpful, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: llr43
Reviews.Content: We were able to get the Blue Mosque room for our first two nights in Istanbul as it was booked the rest of our stay. Even though the weather was cloudy, rainy and cold, we enjoyed the balcony view even for two days. It would be great in the sunshine. We switched to a delux double room, which was really nice with three sets of glass doors and its own outside terrace over a small courtyard. A similar room, and a much better bargain. The hotel had a car service pick us up at the airport free of charge as we were staying at least four days. On departure, they arranged the same service for a 25 Euro trip to Ataturk Airport. On arrival at the hotel, the owner provided us with tea and a rundown on Istanbul sights, recommendations and a map. Hotel Seraglio is a 3-5 minute walk to the Blue Mosque. There are many, many restaurants in the neighborhood, as well as some small grocery shops. The hotel has a bistro for basics and a limited menu. Breakfasts in the hotel breakfast room were very good, with a chef available for omelets on request. The usual hotel efficiency showed in breakfast as tables immediately were cleared and we never saw anyone have to wait for a table. The hotel was kept very clean and both our bedrooms had ample cabinets for hanging clothes and clothes storage. As the hotel was convenient to the tram, we used it often. The tram ticket machines were a good way to break bills for change, 20 lira bills or smaller. On the owner's recommended list was Hamdi Restaurant, across the street from Eminonu, the major boat docks. The lamb and kebobs were excellent; the view wonderful; the service good, although a little slow in providing the bill. Our best meal in Istanbul, however, was two blocks from the hotel. Akbiyik Fish House brought their fish to the table and we chose the second scariest-looking offering, the scorpion fish. It was prepared perfectly, was superbly moist, spicy and tasty. Unforgettable. At departure, the hotel again had the car service pick us up and driver Ali Ekber Bakir of instanbulairporttransfer was excellent. From owner to every staff member, this is a hotel where everyone works for their guests, provides helpful information and sees that you get where you need to be, on time. We selected Hotel Seraglio based on Trip Advisor reviews, and we can see why people love this hotel, its people and its location in the old part of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, very good service, located ideally”
Reviews.Author: ksc2pac
Reviews.Content: Having booked this hotel for our first stay in Istanbul, my wife and I were pleasantly surprised. The hotel is very neat, the interior and the rooms are set out nicely and are very clean. The service is very friendly and helpful and available literally at all times. Furthermore, the hotel is located in the very center of Istanbul, the many sights are reached easily. My wife and I can only recommend this hotel. We will return to this hotel on our next trip to Istanbul this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, attentive team.”
Reviews.Author: Pleasant16
Reviews.Content: Seraglioâ€™s and the Blue Mosque Terrace Suite were exactly what we wanted. A small and new hotel, very friendly staff, good breakfast, spacious room and bathroom, clean. There is a nice Bistro, where they serve tea and drinks and good food. We liked their generousity and got some good recommendations â€“ e.g. Fener Restaurant in Kumkapi (a fish restaurant that offers free shuttle service and delicious food). The location is perfect and quiet. Nevertheless earplugs are a good idea for those who are sensitive to all kinds of noises (e.g. air conditioning, morning prayer). One day we had a private tour. This was expensive, on the other hand our guide showed and told us many interesting and useful things and we did not have to queue. So all together it was worth it â€“ and we enjoyed our stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel worth every lira!”
Reviews.Author: rebeccafromMinneapol
Reviews.Content: We just finished a four day stay at Hotel Seraglio and were thrilled with our choice! great location, helpful complimentary shuttle from airport for 4day guests, terrific comfortable rooms, immaculately clean. AND great staff, especially Kenan, who greeted us on arrival and who became our first friend in Istanbul. the hotel was highly recommended by a friend. what a well managed hotel; the staff could give lessons on how to be gracious and helpful without being invasive. best hotel choice I have made in a long time!

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice”
Reviews.Author: Elisa-Filo
Reviews.Content: Small hotel in the heart of old Istanbul recently renovated. We stayed in the standard room, it was very clean and spacious. The breakfast is very plentiful and varied. Finally the staff is very friendly, especially Kenan: his suggestions were helpful. I was lucky because I found a special price on booking.com. I strongly advise this hotel to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, polite and plaesant personal, very nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Matteopiase
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay in seraglio, personal is very plaesant, they try do do all to make your stay as good as possible. they indicated us many good places to visit and restaurants. we spent also a good time in their bistro, very quiet and confortable. the hotel is located close to the most important Monuments and to the bus station, so we could move easily trough the city from there. The room was clean and large enough for two people, amazing bathroom and cleaned up every day!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Andrew4500
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Seraglio for a brief trip to see Istanbul. It did feature highly in Trip Advisor and quite rightly. Excellent and helpful staff were a feature as was the general cleanliness and facilities of the rooms. Great breakfast with a wide choice including very tasty freshly prepared omelettes. The location is good for all the main sites (though the early morning call to prayers from the Blue Mosque was startling!).
