Overall highly recommended for those wanting a smaller more intimate hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel proved to be an excellent 'home base' for our exploration of Old Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: marjdave
Reviews.Content: We booked for 9 days at the Seraglio Hotel, in the Sultanahmet district of Istanbul, largely on the strength of positive reports on TripAdvisor and we were not disappointed. The hotel is clean, bright and appealingly decorated. Our room was very comfortable; the breakfast buffet was excellent and having the Bistro available through the day and evening for a glass of Turkish tea, glass of wine or a snack or meal was an added bonus. The hotel is well located â€“ very quiet, but also very central to the major sights in Sultanahmet (Old Istanbul). The staff, including Kenon, Celol and Mehmet at the front desk are efficient, gracious and very helpful. We recommend this hotel and would book again any time.

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming small hotel in great situation.”
Reviews.Author: Catherine1703
Reviews.Content: Hotel Seraglio is fairly new (about 1 year old) and is run by very helpful, enthusiastic staff who really seem to want to make your stay enjoyable. It is small (14 rooms) so you feel there is more of a personal touch than with a large hotel. The room we stayed in was spacious and clean with a lovely bathroom (the Hamman bathroom- under floor heated marble seat). This was particularly good as the weekend we stayed was very cold (March) and it was great to warm up in the bathroom after tramping the streets all day. Room was tastefully decorated, and the hotel has a small patio and roof terrace although we didn't use either as it was too cold. Very good location- handy for Sultanamet (Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia) and not far to walk to Grand Bazaar. A little further from Beyoglu but it's easy to get a tram. Surprisingly, it's a quiet area so we had a good night's sleep. Buffet breakfast very good and the large glass of freshly squeezed orange juice/pomegranate juice worth the extra 2 Euros. Hotel staff were discrete but very willing to offer suggestions of places to visit but not pushy with trips. Complimentary afternoon tea of Turkish tea and cakes is a nice touch. My only criticism would be that the food in the Bistro is abit dull and basic. Of course you don't have to eat there and there are many other places to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Sam1221512
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through reviews on this site and boy we were not disappointed. Location is excellent, staff great and the hotel is of a very good standard. Staff cannot do enough for you and their airport transfer service was very efficient. The breakfast is great and plentiful and the free afternoon tea and cakes is another welcome extra. We will be going back and recommending to anyone who is travelling to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel”
Reviews.Author: aysem_duygu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had to go to a wedding at Saturday night, so instead of drunk driving or paying a cab, we decided to stay in a hotel in the nearby area and have a weekend treat in historical peninsula of Istanbul. After reading several good reviews about Seraglio, we reserved a room. This is a lovely small hotel with incredible staff. Once you enter the hotel, you start seeing enthusiastic people trying to help you, comfort you. The hotel is composed of 2 small buildings and a passage from one to another. We stayed in the Hammam Suite (a room with a Turkish bath) which I strongly recommend, try it, you will not regret. Fabulous luxury to have such a facility inside the room, the only downside is you spend so much time in the room, such a pleasure! Our room was large and clean, enough windows to let the sunshine in, a large comfortable bed with nice pillows. The hotel's location is excellent, walking distance to every major tourist attraction like 4 minutes walk to Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque, 7 minutes walk to Great Cistern, 10-15 minutes walk to Grand Bazaar. Excellent fantastic location! And even in such a central location, if you have a car, you can park it in front of the hotel or the staff can take your car their small parking lot. It was such a wonderful short stay, we really loved ever minute of it, we decided to give ourselves some weekend treats at Seraglio, next time we are going to try the Terrace Suit. If you are looking for a 5-star hotel with hundreds of people, huge breakfast buffets, you have to find somewhere else, but if you want a small hotel with an attitude, give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Jace2
Reviews.Content: Staff were very nice. Hotel was clean and tidy. Room was cosy and comfortable. Good quality bathroom (for Turkey), with modern fittings. Lovely double shower but no bath. Breakfast (in downstairs basement) was very nice with live omelette cooking station. However, it seems crazy that they charge an extra 2 Euros per glass for the orange juice! Complimentary afternoon tea (with yummy cake) is served in the hotel restaurant each day. Overall the hotel had a homely feel, mostly because it is simply two large townhouses, with a small front of house staff who we got recognise, because they served us breakfast and afternoon tea as well as manning the reception 24hours. We liked the hotel so much that on our way back through Istanbul (1 week later), we tried to book one more night, but unfortunately the room rate had tripled :-( See my review for Otto House ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: traveller2005world
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was great and very helpful with recommendations on the sights to visit. The room is spacious, clean and comfortable. The bathroom is spacious and clean. During my stay in early February 2011, there was some minor ongoing renovation next door in the afternoon, but the hotel staff was quick to apologize and informed me that the noise will stop after working hours. We arrived in the morning and were treated to breakfast while we wait for the room to be ready. The location is good as it is at a quiet street away from the main street, yet easily assessible and very central, it's a very pleasant walk to the Sultanahmet tram station. Overall very happy with our stay, and my family really felt at home in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: linedanceangel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week for 4 nights, which entitled us to a free airport pickup from Ataturk airport. We had a deluxe room, which was very nice and quite spacious. The hotel is located within a couple of minutes walk of The Blue Mosque and Haggia Sophia and a few minutes walk from the Tokapi Palace. It is in a quiet and quaint cobbled backstreet. The staff are very helpful and give a little talk on arrival to explain the sights etc. We arrived early, having an early morning flight but our room was available, however, the first thing they did was give us breakfast (this was not included for the day we arrived but was given free of charge). The only minus for this room was that they were doing building work on the other side of the wall to our room during the day and the noise was horrendous, but at night you could hear a pin drop, I have never stayed in such a quiet hotel room at night. Also they could have done with some heating in the bathroom and the room was cold during the day as they must turn it off until about 5pm when they expect people to return. Between 5pm and 7pm they serve complimentary coffee\tea and cakes. They have flat screen TVs which is nice, but only one english channel (BBC news), there aren't many Turkish channels either they are mainly Italian (ok for me but if you don't know Italian could be a problem). I would reccommend this hotel whole heartedly, the daytime noise would obviously only be when there is work, which is probably finished now, and the heating issue is only during the day when the weather is very cold (as it was last week). This is a lovely, friendly, helpful and convenient hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to much trouble at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Loose2Boots
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days from Valentines Day last Monday to the Friday. On arriving in the morning just before ten the receptionist, and I am useless with names, sorry,took charge of our cases and said " Right before you go to your room, which is already prepared , go and have some breakfast, then I will tell you all about the area and then show you your room. Well after getting up at 4.00 am the breakfast was most welcome. And I had asked for champagne and a red rose to be placed in the room.............which it was .... Nothing was too much trouble. This was the quietest and most comfortable hotel room ever. Even with the morning prayers, my partner actually SLEPT.....which is a first. The afternoon coffee and cakes ON THE HOUSE were most welcome as was the advise on getting to the airport, which was tram and metro.......instead of " oh we will call you a cab ". highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Proven to live up to its positive reviews. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: ismangun
Reviews.Content: Having only 14 rooms, Seraglio is a nice, quiet, beautiful place to stay in the Sultanahmet area in Istanbul. The hotel staffs are very helpful. They will try hard to make guests feel at home. It's nestled in the quieter area, yet only around 5-10 minutes walk away from all the attractions. I highly recommend Seraglio to all planning to visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel with private hamam in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: katialady
Reviews.Content: We chose Seraglio for our stay in Istanbul and left very happy with our choice! The hotel looks small from the outside, but once you are in, you realize that it takes up two buildings connected with a covered walkway. We chose this hotel for its hamam rooms: rooms with marble bathrooms with heated floors, benches, and walls with the full hamam setup: marble big bowl for water, small bronze bowls for rinsing, super bubbly soap, and a wash cloth in addition to all the usual amenities. The staff turned on the hammam in the morning, so it was nice and hot for our arrival. We were exhausted after the trip, but after a few minutes lying on the marble benches, followed by a thorough wash and scrub, we were ready to face the world again! We would do hammam every night and it was wonderful, except for one little issue: we were so looking forward to relaxing on the heated benches that we were cutting our Istanbul sightseeing short for yet more time in our room :) The room itself was large and beautiful with high ceilings, new furniture, good choice of pillows, comfortable bed, big LCD TV with a good choice of sat channels, a small safe, mini-bar, good heating/a/c unit, fast WiFi, etc. One thing that might be a nuisance for a light sleeper in a busier season is lack of noise insulation of windows and the door. Most rooms look out onto houses on the other side of the street, but we overheard someone telling that the view from the rooms on the top floor is just magnificent (Blue Mosque or Marmara Sea). The entire hotel has interesting compositions throughout, so the breakfast area looks very pleasant. Breakfast buffet was very good: a lot of choices both for Turkish breakfast (5-6 types of cheese, 2 types of olives, white, grey, marble, brown bread, etc) and traditional English, including eggs any type (incl. omelette) made to order. Oh, and don't forget cheese, chocolate crepes and strawberry, chocolate heart-shaped pancakes :) Freshly squeezed juice was 2 EUR extra. Oh, don't forget that they have tea time every evening in their bistro with free tea, coffee, and various tasty sweets. The staff was very professional, pleasant to talk with, provided a lot of information about the area (their list of opening times for all major attractions was a necessity for planning our days), tickets, and tours. The hotel is 3-5 minutes walk in various directions from everything, including the tram for getting to other parts of town. We very much enjoyed the hotel and, if in Istanbul again, will be sure to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff, central location, clean rooms ... excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: Kiari
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in the center of Sultanahmet, just steps from the Blue Mosque. Their taxi came to take us to the airport. The staff is really friendly and ready to help you in all your needs. Upon our arrival they gave us a map of the city with the opening hours of the main monuments. The hotel is new and clean, the rooms are modern and spacious. The breakfast is plentiful and delicious, especially yogurt with honey. We will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Periscope
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed four nights in hotel Seraglio. The stay was pleasant from our very arrival. Reception by young Kenan was pleasant, and he gave us a lot of information about what to do and see during our stay in Istanbul. It was almost like a Welcome-meeting in an organized tour. Great guy. The Blue Mosque Suite was an excellent room with a very nice view and a large terrace with afternoon sun. The off-season price was very reasonable, but with high season starting already in mid-march the prices may be a bit a bit on the upper end. Remember to book trough the hotels web-site and not a third part as we did. Clenliness was excellent. They have a small minus with not refilling the mini-bar, but I could have asked them to. Breakfast was outstanding. Fresh omelette made by a very friendly cook. Spreads, cheeses, jam, cold cuts, sweets, whatever you may want. The airport service offered by the hotel is very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Burger222
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Turkey for the first time and stayed here for a few days. We both loved the hotel! The staff were very friendly and helpful (nothing was too much trouble for them) -- they even told us where we could go for good shopping which was great! :) The rooms were clean and service was prompt. They also accomodated us when we changed our plans in the last minute and needed to stay for another night. All in all it was a great experience and we will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice!”
Reviews.Author: A_Blue_Sea_Shell
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival we were given the longest introduction to a city by hotel staff I have ever had! ;o) Very informative and you could tell they wanted us to have the best time and not miss out on anything! The hotel location is perfect behind Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque. Breakfast buffet was plentiful. The staff very helpful. They have an extractor system in the bathroom which is very strong and blows cold air. It has to be switched off manually in the evening. And during our first night it was on, hence our room was rather cold and drafty. We mentioned it at reception and it was off the second night. When it came to paying at check out there was a bit of an issue over the price. Only when I insisted it was less than what he had put on the bill and started digging for my phone to show him an email as evidence, did he "suddenly" discover that indeed it was less. Not sure what that was all about, but it put a bit of a damper on the stay. Nonetheless I would recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KonstantinosMavris
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel....the deffinition of "value for money".......excellent rooms(very clean,nicely and modern decorated)....located in an area minutes away from all the major tourist sites (Agia Sofia,Topkapi,Blue Mosque,Vasilica Cistern e.t.c)....very kind stuff always willing to help you or serve you...till now the best hotel ever (comparing price and facilities)....

Reviews.Title: “Very good staff, very helpful, great location”
Reviews.Author: jandelin311
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Close to everything in Sultanahmet. We enjoyed the breakfast every morning. I guess the only down-side, if it is a down-side, is hearing the call to prayer very early in the morning before you wanted to wake up. And, forgive me for not remembering the staff's names, but they were all amazingly helpful and courteous. We stayed for two nights before we continued on the rest of our three-week european vacation. Just so you know, buy all of your stuff in Turkey because it's way cheaper than anywhere else in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: gringomadrid
Reviews.Content: Agree with all the previous positive comments: Excellent location, nice room and breakfast, and most of all incredibly helpful and friendly staff. A great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Seraglio is amazing”
Reviews.Author: Kendralyn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a total of 8 days at Seraglio, broken up by a trip to the interior in the middle. We were fortunate to experience two of Seraglio's best rooms--the Blue Mosque suite and the one with the Turkish bath. Both were amazing, though I would recommend the Turkish bath room over the Blue Mosque room (now I want to build a Turkish bath just like the one they have in my own house--it was WONDERFUL!). The staff at the hotel were unfailing helpful and kind and they let us leave some of our bags during our trip to the interior. The free coffee, tea and cakes around dinnertime was much appreciated. This is a very clean, nice hotel, with an expansive hotel breakfast (we didn't realize just how expansive it was until we went on our other trip and stayed at other hotels and basically got bread, cheese and olives for breakfast each day). I can't highly recommend it enough--definitely stay there if you can!

Reviews.Title: “The Friendliest Hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: dizzydiz
Reviews.Content: For starters, the hotel staff are beyond friendly....they are so helpful and really care about the guests. They will go out of there way to accomodate almost any request/need/question/etc. Never have I received the level of personal care from staff like the Seraglio. It's a small boutique hotel in a prime location, on a small quite cozy street near the major tourists attractions. I laughed after reading another review who gave the hotel "value" category a 2...?? I think we spent 60 Euros/night for a very cozy clean little room. Throw in free breakfast, and tea service, and what else can you ask for at that price? I'm more than versed in 5* hotels/world landmark hotels, and felt very comfortable in this hotel. Although the rooms are not upscale, they are nice. The hotel doesnt have a lift, so for people who require one to go upstairs that would be a concern. All in all, what the Seraglio lacks in the "high end" they more than make up for in charm, service, and overall experience..

Reviews.Title: “Seraglio is a small but excellent in every aspect hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dimopoulou2008
Reviews.Content: We were very happy to stay in this hotel as it was more than satisfactory in many aspects. The staff was very friendly and did their best to help us. The breakfast was excellent. The room was very clean, simply but beautifully decorated with a modern bathroom. The location was excellent and within walking distance from Aghia Sofya, Blue Mosque and all tourist attractions. The tram station was only a few blocks away. What else would we need to make our stay perfect?

Reviews.Title: “Feel at home in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: hazinheira
Reviews.Content: Amazing service! The staff welcomed us in a very friendly way, with tea and turkish sweets, and explained us what to see in the surrounding areas. Because we had reserved the suite we were offered a fruit plate and a bottle of wine. Internet is complementary and the hotel is extremely well located, 3 minutes walking from the Blue Mosque. You can see the mosque from the suite's terrace. The room was clean and spacious. Breakfast was not varied but it was good enough. The cakes were home made!!! Definitely a place to return.

Reviews.Title: “Kenan Sancelik Front Desk was exceptional”
Reviews.Author: WorcesterPark66
Reviews.Content: After the hotel trying to take the payment before we travelled and the taxi not being at the airport to meet us, I was not having great expectations of our stay. I was wrong! the Seraglio is in the best ever position, was spotlessly clean and Kenan at the front desk helped make this weeekend a weekend to remember he was a treasure. Do take sturdy shoes as the cobbled streets are hard on the feet.

Reviews.Title: “The most warm and beautiful boutique hotel, Athens Greece”
Reviews.Author: VASO-DIMITRIS
Reviews.Content: Seraglio is the most beautiful boutique hotel we've ever visit. It is located in a very quiet neighourhood and at the same time you are at the centre of Istanbul. The room was nice and clean and we especially enjoyed the hamam inside it. The quality of the breakfast was very good and we enjoyed the home made cakes and the delicious omelettes that chef was preparing for us. But most of all we appreciated the extremely helpful service of the hotel. Kenan and Jelal were very polite and very helpful with us. They always had a good piece of advice for us and we are very happy we've met them. We strongly recommend this very warm and hospitable hotel and we beleive that it's the best choice of the town.

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality and service!”
Reviews.Author: ibahena
Reviews.Content: The rooms were spotless. The front desk was very helpful in providing tips on things to do. The breakfast was very good and they let us have breakfast on the day we were checking in while we waited for our room to be ready as we had arrived early.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: pearljamfans
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Seraglio in September for one week with our our two sons. We all absolutely loved this hotel. The young men who run the hotel, Cebl, Kenen and Murat, were extremely helpful and friendly. Not only were they helpful with information on seeing Istanbul, but they were also very helpful in dealing with other problems, like trying to get train tickets in England for our youngest son who was going to England to study after our vacation in Turkey. The two rooms we had were very comfortable and felt like home. The breakfast was excellent and we loved the complimentary cake and tea every afternoon. We always looked forward to that after a day of sightseeing. The location of the hotel could not be better. It was a 5 minute walk to the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia. Whether it was museums, restaurants, or shopping, everything was an easy walk from the hotel. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul and especially want to note that the staff truly enjoyed helping their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied with our choice”
Reviews.Author: VictorAthens
Reviews.Content: Very kind and helpful staff. Very clean. Big room. The Wi-Fi had a perfect signal in the room. Very close to all the sites of the old city. Good breakfast but it would be better if there was more variety. The area of the hotel is very nice and you feel safe. There are a lot of restaurants around.

Reviews.Title: “Great small Hotel, Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: paulschwarz
Reviews.Content: We visited Instanbul in November 2010 and stayed 4 days in this small and cushy hotel. The hotel is realtively new, so everything is clean and shiny. But this is not the only reason to stay in Seraglio: the service is amazing!! We felt very well received and the staff did just anything possible to make our stay perfect. I had my birthday while staying there and that evening the staff surprised me with a special gift. They are just amazing. The breakfast was good and on the evening the hotel offers complementary service of tea and self made cookies. Delicious. The only thing that was not so comfortable was the sound of the cooler in the roof, on 24/7. With closed windows it's imperceptible though. All in all was a great stay and we should we go back to Istanbul any time, we'll sure be staying at Seraglio.

Reviews.Title: “Service & Location: All amazing”
Reviews.Author: mcikato
Reviews.Content: What most impressed my wife and I is the service and the people. Always smiling, never a "NO", very very helpful. It was the first time in my life that the receptionist, one doing the check in, invited us something to drink and talked about Istambul for 30 minutes. I never seen such a personalized service, which I really appreciate. In addition, I never seen people so nice to our daughter than in the Hotel. Actually it's all the Turkish people, they always stopped and say something to her. The location couldn't be better! 5 minutes walking from the Blue Mosque, 20 from Grand Bazar. Right in the center of the old town, which is lovely by the way. The hotel itself is small, but very very nice. It is a new hotel so the rooms are in perfect condition. And the value for what you get is the best I ever experience. I absolutely recommend this hotel. It is amazing how a helpful staff as the Seraglio's staff can affect one's vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful friendly small hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ssvancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Seraglio Oct 6-13 2010. The hotel staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. The front desk really went the extra mile in making sure we were comfortable and showered our 4 year old daughter with lots of attention and affection, which really helped since we had just flown from Vancouver. The breakfast spread was tasty, authentic, varied, and filling enough to give you energy for the day. The afternoon tea and cakes were another nice touch. The Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia were a 5 minute walk away, Topkapi Palace 10 minutes walk. Dinner at the Hotel's restaurant was a pleasant surprise since dining options in the immediate area are mostly of the tourist trap variety. As an example of their high level of care, Mehmet and Celal arranged for a simple breakfast and coffee for us to have when we left at 5:45 in the morning. It was a very nice gesture since breakfast is not served before 8 am. This is a small, family-run hotel, and we had very little trouble communicating with the staff. Their English is quite good. The rest of the staff, including Ali, Gogril, and of course Kenan (the manager) were also helpful in arranging transportation and restaurant reservations. Our room, the Hammam suite, was spotless and simple. We have stayed in more expensive hotels in our travels that were nowhere near as clean. As first time visitors to Istanbul we were out and about for most of every day we were there, but those few hours in the morning and the evening at Hotel Seraglio were made very comfortable for us and our daughter by the wonderful and kind staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ukiotoshi
Reviews.Content: Perfect place to stay in Istanbul, since it is close to the important sightseeings. Actually it is at the heart of most important places to visit. The staff was extreemly friendly and helpful. We had bed and breakfast and even though it is not the best, the breakfast was good. The room was very clean well decorated. We had a good time staying in the hotel and Istanbul and We extremly suggest the hotel for anyone planning to stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: GavinSwansea
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife in the Blue Mosque Terrace Suite after reading reviews on tripadvisor. The hotel and room were exellent and could not be faulted. The hotel breakfast is top class and the complimentary tea and cake are perfect for relaxing after a days sight seeing and shopping. We ate in the hotels restarant and had dinner on our balcony as the food was exellent. the staff are very helpful and the service is personal. To sumarise if your looking for a nice quiet boutique hotel with all the service and quality but without the price tag then you can't go wrong staying here. Cagri Yilmaz i wish you and your staff all the best for the future and keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't go anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: 50_s0methings
Reviews.Content: My husband chose this hotel for a surprise birthday party with family and friends and it couldn't have been better. The hotel is spotless and the rooms lovely. Huge beds and lovely bathrooms. The location is very good being in walking distance of many of the tourist sites What makes this hotel exceptional is the staff. We asked for things from the bar which they didn't have but the barman just popped to the local shop and bought some. They were even happy for us to drink our own drinks and provided glasses. Breakfast was good and Bistro a nice place to have a drink. I have never been in a hotel where you are given a welcome drink and a guide to what to see and where it is. I couldn't recommend the hotel any higher.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: ems002
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location in the heart of the old town (a couple of mins walk from the Blue mosque and tram links etc), complimentary afternoon tea and breakfast included in the price, clean linen supplied each day (the bed sheets were lovely and soft), spacious and clean bathroom, staff were very helpful arranging dinner bookings and airport transfers. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Just the Friendliest and Most Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: diandtony
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seraglio Hotel in November 2010. Its a wonderful little hotel right in the middle of Sultanahmet, very close to major tourist attractions, and the tram. The staff at the Seraglio are second-to-none; the most friendly group of people, who can't do enough to make your stay a really pleasant experience. The hotel itself is spotlessly clean. Our room was spacious, clean and with top fittings. The bathroom was large and beatifully appointed. The hotel offers complementary coffee and cakes each afternoon in its bistro, and also welcomed us with a coffee on arrival and a full explanation of Istanbul, and how to best get about. We also had a light meal in the bistro on one evening, and that was terrific too. We felt this boutique hotel was definitely the best we've stayed in for the tariff. We would highly recomment a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and service in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Smertios
Reviews.Content: I recommend Hotel Seraglio. I am sure you cannot find a better value in Istanbul. Location Perfect location. The hotel shares a quiet street with other boutique hotels. Walking distance to all the tourist attractions (blue mosque, Haga Sophia, etc.) and plenty of restaurants and shops. Room The room is big, sparkling hardwood floors, comfortable bed and large flat screen TV. TV has no English channels. The towels were on the thin side. The room was on the third floor with no elevator, but the bell person brought the luggage up, so no problem. Service The service is very friendly. They arrange for pick up and drop off at the airport for reasonable fee. Breakfast Breakfast is served in a room in the basement. It was plentiful. Fruits, pastries, eggs.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel great location 5minute walk to blue mosque”
Reviews.Author: mickc50
Reviews.Content: just rturned from a 3 night stop at the hotel seraglio with my wife and friends and had a really nice stay in istanbul.the hotel is in a great location only 5 minutes walk to blue mosque.the nice thing is it is located in a quiet street with very little noise in the evening.we could not fault the rooms we had a mamman superior which was a nice way to unwind after a day sightseeing.the hotel also offers complementary afternoon tea and cakes. staff always helpful offrering advise on sights and restaurants. on our final night in the bistro we were treated to a complementary bottle of winewhich is quite expensive in istanbul.we have one suggestion for the hotel it would have been nice to have tea/cofee making facilities in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with everything”
Reviews.Author: Freeport_IlTraveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel Seraglio was in the old town of Istanbul close to the Blue Mosque and Cistern actually everything we wanted to see. Great location. From the moment we were picked up at the airport by shuttle arranged by the hotel to the moment we were dropped off to return home just a great experience. OUr room was on the main floor , with a courtyard at our disposal. Beautiful breakfast buffet , with made to order omelets daily. Fresh fruit, pastries. Tea from 5-7 every afternoon in the Bistro. Staff was VERY helpful and friendly. Probably the nicest hotel I've stayed in in Europe other than one arranged by a tour group.

Reviews.Title: “Can't ask for better service!”
Reviews.Author: inpash
Reviews.Content: I strongly recommend this boutique hotel. The service is GREAT! The location is ideal, walking distance to all the major sites and close to the Tram. The hotel is also immaculately clean and the rooms are a good size and very comfortable. It is a great value for the money. I would stay there again. The staff is very professional and speak English. Celal, Kana and Mehmet (front desk) were very nice and extremely helpful in helping us get around the city. You won't regret staying here and the breakfast is awesome!

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Accommodation in Old Stamboul â€“ Seraglio Hotel”
Reviews.Content: The six slender minarets of the Blue Mosque glow against the night. Sipping our complimentary bottle of Sarafin cabernet on the terrace of our room, we succumb to the view and forget the strains of travel. Also forgotten is our neatly piled luggage where Kenan, the Seraglioâ€™s Front Office Manager had instructed his colleague to leave it while he gave us a welcoming overview spiced with apple tea. Cagri Yilmaz converted his grandparents Ottoman home into this comfortable and perfectly-located 14 room boutique hotel. A seraglio refers to the female quarters of a Turkish palace, a princeâ€™s small palace, or a grand Turkish house built around a courtyard. The Seraglio Hotelâ€™s Blue Mosque Suite is fit for a prince. Near the stairway to the breakfast room, thereâ€™s a small courtyard garden. Down the stairs, eggs are cooked to order and complimented by fruits and pastries. The rear of the hotel faces a quiet street where one can sit in the open fronted cafÃ© enjoying mezes with drinks before, after or instead of sight-seeing. The Sultanahmet section of Istanbul, named for the Sultan Ahmet who built the Blue Mosque, is the center of the Old Istanbul. Travelers arriving on the Orient Express referred to it as â€˜Stamboulâ€™ (e.g., Graham Greenâ€™s â€œStamboul Trainâ€�). The Seraglio is situated here amongst other small boutique hotels with a sprinkling of cafes and shops giving it a quiet urban neighborhood appeal. A short stroll takes you to many of the remarkable historical sights: the Aya Sofya, Blue Mosque, Byzantine Hippodrome, Basilica Cistern and the Topkai Palace where Peter Ustinov comically attempts to steal the Sultanâ€™s emerald in the 1964 eponymous movie. A few more minutes takes you to the Grand Bazaar or either of two old hammams we visited where you can have your travel cares steamed and scrubbed away. Kenan Saicelik, whose surname means â€˜yellow steelâ€™, is a man of steel in response to all requests. He made suggestions for tours, he booked our tours, he called airlines, he arranged our airport transfers, he told us when to go or not to go to various sights AND he saved our wine for us when we left it in our room fridge during a three day excursion. Kenan and his colleagues are helpful, courteous and a large part of the reason the Seraglio is a grand accommodation in Old Stamboul.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly”
Reviews.Author: ellyp41
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel Seraglio for a week. Coming in the door we were met by a friendly, welcoming smile. The staff was so helpful and kind all through our stay, and made us feel at home. Breakfast was excellent - also served with big smiles. In the afternoon we were welcome to enjoy free coffe/tea and cakes. The area is the best we could wish for, quiet and nice, and close to all sights. Almost forgetting about the room, - it was a nice, newly decorated room with the possibility to sit on the veranda if we prefered. We did not as it was a bit chilly and raining. Bathroom was spacious and delicate. Sweey dreams in comfy beds. No doubt, this is our place in istanbul!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel; wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: OZTravellerAus
Reviews.Content: We booked this from Trip Advisor recommendations and were not disappointed. The room was great; the staff very helpful; the breakfasts were substantial and had a great variety of food and the free evening tea and cakes were yummy! You HAVE to try the apple tea. Great.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Sukibot
Reviews.Content: We opted for the deluxe room which is twice the size of the standard room. It was so spacious and clean. The bathroom was new and cool-looking and spotless. The room contained this great wardrobe for people like me who donâ€™t like to unpack and put things in drawers. It had a lower level for me to put my entire suitcase in and big cubbyholes for me to shove clothing and other stuff in. This way I could see right away where my stuff was. Not necessary for home use but perfect for hotel use. Although it was in the touristy crowded Sultanahmet neighborhood, our hotel was off a side street and you could hear a pin drop at nighttime. The staff was extremely helpful and nice. The breakfasts were fantastic including custom omelets! This made a happy change from all the hard-boiled eggs I had been eating at other hotels. Next time I am in Istanbul, I will definitely book here again. I have already recommended it to a friend who will be in Istanbul in December . (Deluxe double, #101)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and awesome staff!”
Reviews.Author: newberries
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here and had a great stay. The location is in easy walking distance of all the major sights and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Breakfast was included and was very good. The only drawback was the rather treacherous winding staircase.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Silmarij
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were offered Turkisch coffee and got advice on were to go and see. Breakfast was fresh and varied. The room was spacious with a large shower. The hotel looked brand new (7 months old) and clean. One minor point was the noice of the vans on the roof, which prohibited us to open a window at night. But airconditioning was available. We definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: suzan06
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel was excellent. The staff were very pleasant, the rooms were clean, modern and very comfortable. The buffet breakfast was delicious with a huge variety of hot and cold dishes. The hotel itself is ideally located in one of the main tourist areas and is less than 5 minutes walk from the tram line which connects to the rest of the public transport system. As we stayed 5 nights the hotel provided us with a free shuttle service to and from the airport, which was much appreciated. We would definitely go back to this hotel and have recommended it to all our friends and family, lone travellers included.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust221
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor & were not dissapointed. The hotel's location is perfect -- a couple blocks from the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia. One of the best parts of our European trip was waking up early in the morning and walking by the Mosque before any of the tourists/crowds infiltrated the area. It's also in a great area for dinner - with several quaint restaurants on cobble-stone streets -- although beware of tourist restaurants that hike up the prices and are filled with americans with cameras. We ate at a local "Meat House", and despite its name was delicious and filled with locals. The service in the hotel was great - they let us check in before 10am and even gave us turkish coffee while we waited for our room to be ready. Definitely would recommend as a good-value place to make your homebase in Istanbul. One note -- you will wake up (around 5am) to sounds of praying from the mosque. I actually thought that added to the experience, but my husband found it annoying since it lasts about 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION...GREAT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: IvanUrrieta
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights, it was a great experience. The Hotel is located just a few steps from te main attractions in Sultanahmet. (Aya Sofya, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Basilica Cistern, Archaeology Museums). The room was very spacious, clean and nice. (A little bit noisy during night if there are people talking in the terrace). The breakfast buffet is very good, with the option of an omellette freshly made. But, no doubt, the best of the Seraglio Hotel is the Staff. Celal and Kenan are always ready to help you, to give you suggestions of what to do and where to go. They helped us a lot always with a smile. One of the best services I've ever received. Congratulations!!!!!! Seraglio Hotel is a great place to stay in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - location was perfect”
Reviews.Author: ebenezer15
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 6 nights at this hotel. We were on a shopvacation. We had a great time and this place offered us everything we could possible need. It was in a safe and perfect location. We walked to everything but the terminal for the Bosperous. It was clean, the breakfast was out of this world, the staff was all very helpful, the rooms were spacious, and the 5 o'clock tea was a pleasant, but nice suprise. If we go back we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: NicoleDavison
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently booked a stay at the Seraglio Hotel in Istanbul. It has everything to recommend it - an excellent location, fantastic service (including daily complementary teas, coffees and cake in the afternoon), cleanliness and reasonably priced. Unfortunately, we had to fly home a day early due to a family emergency. The hotel staff could not have been kinder or more accommodating. Although we had pre-paid, there was no question about us receiving a refund which was offered without us even asking. their kindness made a diffult time easier.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality redefined at the heart of Istanbul's old city”
Reviews.Author: Julia_Kartik
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Seraglio and right from the very moment we reached the hotel, we felt at home....we were greeted by the young and amazingly hospitable team of young professionals Murat,Ali, Kenan and Celal from the hotel staff. All of them have been extremely helpful, cheerful, friendly and spent a lot of time with us advising on the things to do as we had only 3 days and had to pack in a lot. The entire staff made our stay and the overall maiden experience to Istanbul a memorable one. If you are looking for a hotel (not so commercial, and small in size) and wanting a cozy experience, where you are made to feel at home, in the heart of the old city and literally a stones throw from Aye Sofia, Blue mosque and Topkapi palace....we strongly recommend this place. The room was also very spacious, light, modern and very clean. Breakfast was very good and they even have tea time for all the guests every evening where you are served free tea and cakes! The hotel is also the setting for a lovely bar where you can enjoy al fresco dining and some water pipe smoking. Don't bother looking any further for a hotel .. Book Hotel Seraglio now! .. you will not be disappointed. We intend to come back to Istanbul again in the future and we will certainly stay here. Only small issue was the quality of satellite TV channels which were not so good as many of the channels do not work, however who cares about TV when you are in such a magnificient city that has so much to offer. Food Tip at Seraglio : Vegeterians would love the dearth of overall veggies options in Istanbul, Serglio's vegeterian mezze platter is something worth trying... Thanks again to all the staff and Management at Hotel Seraglio. Other hotels can learn a lot from you about high levels of service and free flowing good will gestures. We hope you remain the same in years to come. keep up the good work as it is really appreciated by your guests. Food tips for vegeterians: Cafe Sofa close to Hotel Seraglio, offers a nice variety of vegeterian options, do not miss the Imam Bayaldi. Kartik and Julia

Reviews.Title: “A friendly, clean hotel that represents good value.”
Reviews.Author: BronAustralia
Reviews.Content: An excellent "boutique" hotel within a short walk from the city's main attractions. The hotel staff were exceptional and made our stay. The room was clean and well maintained. A great place to stay for a few days to explore this amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, small hotel in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Invisible_Shadow
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with the Hotel Seraglio from the moment I arrived to my departure. On arrival, hotel staff were genuinely interested in our trip to Istanbul and gave us advice on the different parts of Istanbul and tips on how to save money. The hotel is located in Old Istanbul and is about a 5 minute walk away from the Blue Mosque. The hotel is on a quiet street, but has two entraces, a main entrance and a cafe side entrance, if you stay on the main entrance facing side, you'll have a very quiet room, if you are on the cafe side, it can get a bit noiser at the weekends. The room itself was a very good size, the king size bed was massive. A very modern set-up, with wall mounted LCD TV and a very modern polished bathroom. The room and bathroom were spotless. Usual facilities were available including fridge, in room safe and satellite TV. There is a street facing cafe in the hotel that offers free cakes, tea and coffee to hotel guests in the afternoon which is a nice touch. Breakfast was superb, buffet style with a fairly good selection of food as well as the option to have an omlette freshly made. There is a free Wi-Fi network throughout the hotel that was fast and always accessible from any part of the hotel. On my departure day, the hotel arranged a packed breakfast for me as I was leaving at 5am. All in all, a very friendly, very clean hotel in a perfect spot for checking out Old Istanbul. I'd certainly stay here again when I return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “I stayed at the Seraglio for one week...”
Reviews.Author: pinkfood
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Seraglio for one week with a friend. The staff were always most courteous and willing to help. My friend and I had a friend that lived in another part of Istanbul that would come to hotel to meet with us and the staff were also most hospitable to her as well. Upon our arrival, we requested to change our room for two separate beds and they immediately helped us change rooms. Also, our reservation was somewhat complicated with different parties coming and going, overlapping and such; this was never an issue for the hotel. They were understanding and accommodated our needs seamlessly. The room was clean and well-appointed. There was also free wifi access throughout the hotel. Breakfast was great with a variety of fresh fruits, cheeses, olives, eggs, and other western style fare. The hotel is also perfectly located in Sultanahmet and very close to the major sites of the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and the palace. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Seraglio immensely and I fully recommend it to everyone wanting to stay in the old city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for great price”
Reviews.Author: LukeArnaoutakis
Reviews.Content: The prices were great, room was spacious and comfortable, the bathroom had everything you need and a elegant shower and most of all the Staff helped you with anything you need and all of the were very friendly. I recommend this hotel to anybody and when I visit Instanbul again I sure will go and stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: alliesana
Reviews.Content: Lovely brand-new hotel in the heart of Sultanahmet. We found Seraglio through TripAdvisor and are happy to confirm otherâ€™s glowing reviews of this gem. We arrived late at night after a lengthy bus trip from Cappadocia, and the staff was very welcoming. Our room was crisp and well-appointed. The best shower weâ€™d used in a couple weeks. There is a safe in each room to store your passport and other valuables. The hotel is centrally located to many of the tourist sites. The Blue Mosque is a five minute walk, and the Aya Sofia is maybe 10 minutes. It took us about 20 minutes to get to the Grand Bazaar, and the Cemberlitas Hamman is about 10 minutes away. The reception and restaurant staff are all proficient in English. The buffet breakfast is delicious â€“ in addition to the standard Turkish breakfast of white cheese, cucumbers, tomatoes, olives and bread, they also offered an omelet bar, cake, hard-boiled eggs and lots of other treats to taste. We appreciated the food options varied a little from morning to morning â€“ variety keeps things interesting! We also appreciated that our stay included a free dinner in their restaurant as well as a transfer to the Istanbul airport.

Reviews.Title: “This was a fantastic hotel right in the centre of the main attractions”
Reviews.Author: amandaBuffy66
Reviews.Content: The staff were amazing - really helpful and friendly. The breakfast was superb - we had a teenager and a seven year old and they loved it. Rooms were spotless and large, bathrooms were clean with lovely towels and soaps etc., A perfect hotel and location.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable hotel in the heart of Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: OmarHussain
Reviews.Content: We stayed for seven nights in this lovely hotel, the rooms were clean, service was excellent and the food was well priced and tasty!! All the main attractions were within walking distance. We would definitely recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mjs24
Reviews.Content: This is a fine, little hotel that is very well located in the old district near the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and a number of other sites. It includes a good breakfast, good internet connection, good cable tv service, a very nicely-appointed room and extremely helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: 3barazi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in old Istanbual and it's good place to stay in to discover the old city. Don't expect to see malls or modern places there. As we arrived we felt that we are at home the staff was very helpfull explaining to us the locations, surroundings and the tourist programs they have. The room was clean and the furniture was like new. The windows are sound proofed but you might hear ocasional noise ususally not at sleeping time.Breakfast was elegant and delicious. The resturant is much much better than the surrounding resturants it serves simple,fresh and clean meals .It's always a better idea to eat in a well reputed resturant. There were certain complains in the reviews which has been fixed by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base of operations for seeing old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: BakuTerry
Reviews.Content: We visited Istanbul for the 1st time last week and chose the Seraglio based on the glowing reviews on TripAdvisor - they were not wrong. The Sergalio is a great base; ideally placed for the sights of the old city, very comfortable/clean rooms, very helpful staff, and very good value for money. We opted for a room with the private hammam - this is definitley worth the extra cash and comes in handy after spending hrs walking around the old city and its treasures. There are plenty of mini-markets close to the hotel - so no shortage of food/drink, although the mini-bar is cheap by usual European standards. I have read several reviews which complained about the breakfast - the offering is not comprehensive but is good enough for a quick bite; freshly made omelettes, tea/coffee, fresh melon, etc - the only fault I could find was that the OJ was squash rather than juice. The Seraglio may lack a business centre, swimming pool, casino, gym and all the other 5 star trimmings but I would happily recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a good quality mid-range hotel in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,excellent location and personalised service. Would love to stay here again”
Reviews.Author: pckDelhi_India
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in walking distance of all the places of interest. Managed like a home, the staff is very polite and responsive to your requests. The rooms are neat and clean and remind you of your own bedroom. The breakfast is good and worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A Great little Hotel right in the middle of everything.”
Reviews.Author: Kotsos_Thessaloniki
Reviews.Content: It is a new, modern, comfortable Hotel, which made our stay in Istanbul a pleasent experience. The lights in the elevator whould go on and off sometimes, but it was no problem. The room was comfortable, with large bed, large closet, and roomy bathroom with a big shower. Flat screen Sat TV, and stae of the art air conditioner. The only thing dissappointing was that the light in our bathroom were not working at all, for some reason, and during our 3 night stay, even though staff were notified twice, they were never fixed. It is located right in the Sultanahmet area, which is right in the middle of all the major sightseeing. There are plenty of little bars, and restaurants in the area, and a tram station nearby which will take you almost anywjere in Istanbul. The staff is very friendly, they all speek English, and very helpfull. The breakfast buffet offers almost anything you would want for breakfast. Overall it is a Great Hotel, superior Value for Money.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Seraglio
HotelInfo.Address: Amiral Tafdil Sokak | No: 32 Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34400, Turkey
